title: Suggestions for something like Caxton
content:
I’ve been using Caxton (the newest OpenType version) for a book project, but I’m getting to the point where I’m frustrated by its lack of advanced typographic features (small caps, superscripts, etc) so I’m wondering if there’s a similar looking typeface that has more of a complete feature set. I really like the look of Caxton, but cannot for the life of me think of something similar enough to switch to.

Thanks!
author: seanglenn

comments.content: Caxton is pretty unique. How about [Karmina](http://web.archive.org/web/20090629040139/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/typetogether/karmina_ot/)? See the typographic features [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20090629040139/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/typetogether/karmina_regular_ot/?s=c). SC and Superscript included.

Not bad, I’ll look into that one. Going through my library is becoming a dull exercise in “No, not that one, not that one, not that one...”

Sean Glenn
